fullstatement: The child develops the ability to group similar objects and phenomena together based on their common features. They can sort objects into categories, such as animals and plants, or round and square objects.
Rewritten Statement: groups toys by shape or type, like animals or blocks.

fullstatement: The child starts to analyze and reason out the differences and similarities of objects and phenomena through keen observation.
Rewritten Statement: Notices and Points out how objects are alike or different.

fullstatement: Child asks a question, gathers information, and makes predictions
Rewritten Statement: Asks questions and guesses what might happen next.

fullstatement: Can formulate qQuestions
Rewritten Statement: Asks simple questions.

fullstatement: Understands the concept of gathering information to be analyzed later.
Rewritten Statement: Collects objects and looks at them closely.

fullstatement: Can use the beginnings of predictive reasoning.
Rewritten Statement: Starts to guess what might happen next in simple situations.

fullstatement: Child plans and conducts investigations and experiments
Rewritten Statement: Explores and plays with objects to see what happens.

fullstatement: Child formulates hypotheses or predictions'
Rewritten Statement: Tries to guess what will happen next during play.

fullstatement: Child gathers and uses data'
Rewritten Statement: Points and Explores objects to learn about them.

fullstatement: Child analyzes results and makes conclusions'
Rewritten Statement: Notices what happens and thinks about why it happened.

fullstatement: Acquire scientific knowledge related to life science (properties of living things).
Rewritten Statement: explore and Notice different plants and animals around them.

fullstatement: Acquire scientific knowledge related to earth science (properties of the earth and objects in the sky).
Rewritten Statement: Look up at the sky and point to the sun, moon, or stars.

fullstatement: Child analyzes results, draws conclusions, and communicates results
Rewritten Statement: Looks at what happens, thinks about it, and tells others.

fullstatement: Data Interpreting
Rewritten Statement: Recognizes and responds to patterns or changes in their environment.

fullstatement: Student uses critical thinking to analyze and interpret investigations.
Rewritten Statement: Examines and Explores objects to understand how they work.

fullstatement: Expressive Communication
Rewritten Statement: Uses sounds, gestures, or simple words to share needs or feelings.

fullstatement: Child engages in and maintains positive relationships and interactions with adults
Rewritten Statement: Smiles and reaches out to familiar adults for comfort and play.

fullstatement: Child expresses confidence in own skills and positive feelings about self
Rewritten Statement: Claps and smiles after stacking blocks.

fullstatement: Child has a sense of belonging to family, community, and other groups
Rewritten Statement: Smiles and reaches out to familiar people.

fullstatement: Child engages in prosocial and cooperative behavior with adults
Rewritten Statement: Shares toys and Helps adults with simple tasks.

fullstatement: Child engages in and maintains positive interactions and relationships with other children
Rewritten Statement: Smiles and plays happily with other children.

fullstatement: Child engages in cooperative play with other children
Rewritten Statement: plays together with friends.

fullstatement: Shows interest in another child‚Äôs actions
Rewritten Statement: Watches what another child is doing.

fullstatement: Child uses basic problem-solving to resolve conflicts with other children
Rewritten Statement: Shares toys to solve playtime disagreements with friends.

fullstatement: Child expresses a broad range of emotions and recognizes these emotions in self and others
Rewritten Statement: Smiles, frowns, or cries to show different feelings and Notices when others do the same.

fullstatement: Child expresses care and concern toward others
Rewritten Statement: Shows kindness by hugging or comforting others when they are upset.

fullstatement: Child manages emotions with increasing independence
Rewritten Statement: Calms down by themselves after getting upset.

fullstatement: Child recognizes self as a unique individual having own abilities, characteristics, emotions, and interests
Rewritten Statement: Notices own reflection and Points to self in the mirror.
